eng: 11 feb 2010honorouble speaker.
xho: 11 feb 2010somlomo ohloniphekileyo.

eng: we also recognise the role of the leader of the inkatha freedom party, inkosi mangosuthu buthelezi, who also called for madiba’s release, as well as that of other political prisoners and the return of exiles.
xho: sibamkela ngokukodwa abo basuka kumazwe angaphesheya ukuze babe kunye nathi, uhelene pastoors, umichael dingake basebotswana, umnu andimba toivo ya toivo weswapo enamibia.

eng: let us pursue the ideal for which madiba has fought his entire life – the ideal of a democratic and free society, in which all persons live together in harmony and with equal opportunities.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyo,umzantsi afrika kufanele kwakhona uqaphele ngokupheleleyo, indima ebalulekileyo eyadlalwa ngowayesakuba ngumongameli we-anc, uqabane oliver tambo, nowathi wakhela eli lizwe isisekelo sokuba ngumzekelo oqaqambileyo wenkululeko nentando yesininzi.

eng: honourable members,we called a joint sitting in the evening so that the majority in our country, workers and schoolchildren, can be part of the occasion.
xho: yaba bubunkokheli bakhe obuqaqambileyo, ukubona into isekude, nombono ocacileyo okwakhokelela ukuba i-anc iqinise ekutyhaleleni kwisivumelwano ekubonisweneyo ngaso.

eng: this includes local infrastructure and tertiary projects and literacy projects, home-based care, school maintenance and early childhood development initiatives.
xho: le yimisebenzi efana neyokwakha, unakekelo lwezempilo lwasekhaya nolwasekuhlaleni, neeprojekti zokusingqongileyo.

eng: we have directed the agency to work faster to establish its structures, throughout the country, so that it can assist us to mainstream youth development programmes within government.
xho: sityumbe imimandla ethile efuna ukuphuculwa, esiza kuyisebenzisa ukuya phambili, kuquka nokuqinisekisa ngeeprojekti ezijolise kakhulu ekusekweni kwemisebenzi.

eng: we have also set ambitious targets for skills development, to produce additional engineers and technicians, and to increase the number of qualified mathematics and science teachers.
xho: sakha isizwe esisekelezelwe ekwenziweni komsebenzi, ngokuphucula ucwangciso kwakunye nohlolo novavanyo lomsebenzi.

eng: we must also increase the number of youth who enter learnerships in the privateand public sectors.
xho: sikwafuna ukuquka amanyathelo okulingana ngokwesini kwinkqubo yomsebenzi karhulumente.

eng: this includes building and upgrading hospitals and clinics, and further improving the working conditions of healthcare workers.
xho: la manyathelo ayakuqinisekisa ukuba abantu ababhinqileyo, abantwana nabantu abakhubazekileyo bayakwazi ukufikelela kumathuba ophuhliso.

eng: we are therefore making interventions to lower maternal mortality rates, to reduce new hiv infections and to effectively treat hiv and tuberculosis.
xho: njengoko nisazi, sizibophelele kwiindawo zantlanu eziphambili emakuqalwe ngazo: ezemfundo, ezempilo, uphuhliso lwamaphandle novuselelo lomhlaba, ukudala umsebenzi ofanelekileyo, nokulwa ulwaphulo-mthetho.

eng: we will also reduce infant mortality through the massive immunisation programme.
xho: ukongeza, siza kusebenzela ukuphucula ukusebenza koorhulumente basekhaya, uphuhliso lweziseko zoncedo neendawo zokuhlala koluntu.

eng: we have directed law-enforcement agencies to take a tougher stance on lawlessness in balfour and other areas.
xho: kufuneka sandise inani lolutsha olungenela uqeqesho emisebenzini kumacandelo abucala nawakarhulumente.

eng: we will set up a guarantee fund of r1 billion to incentivise the private banking and housing sector, to develop new products to meet this housing demand.
xho: sizidibanise nebhanki yophuhliso yasemazantsi e-afrika ukuphucula iindlela ezisebenza ngayo izibhedlele zikarhulumente kunye nee-ofisi zazo zesithili.

eng: bakwethu,ngonyaka odlule sathi, abantu basemakhaya nabo banelungelo lokuba nogesi, amanzi, izindlu zangasese ezigijima amanzi nemigwaqo.
xho: kwakhona sikwasebenzisana nebhanki yophuhliso yasemazantsi e-afrika kunye nequmrhu lophuhliso lwamashishini, kwinkqubo yobehlulelani bukarhulumente nabezoshishino labucala ukuphucula izibhedlele nokubonelela iiprojekthi ngemali.

eng: fellow south africans,as we celebrate madiba’s release today, we recommit ourselves to reconciliation, national unity, non-racialism and building a better future together as south africans, black and white.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyo,siyaqhubekeka ngamalinge wethu okuncothula urhwaphilizo nenkohliso ekunikezelweni kwemisebenzi neenkqubo zeziniki maxabiso, nakwizicelo zeempepha mvume zokuqhuba, inkxaso-mali karhulumente yezentlalo namaxwebhu ezazisi, phakathi kwezinye.

eng: honourable speaker of the national assembly,chairperson of the national council of provinces.
xho: 13 feb 2014somlomo ohloniphekileyo wendlu yowiso-mthetho yesizwe,sihlalo webhunga lesizwe lamaphondo (i-ncop).

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop.
xho: sekela somlomo wendlu yowiso-mthetho yesizwe nosekela sihlalo we-ncop.

eng: deputy president of the republic, honourable kgalema motlanthe.
xho: sekela mongameli werhiphabliki, ohloniphekileyo ukgalema montlanthe.

eng: former deputy president baleka mbethe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary.
xho: owayesakuba ngusekela mongameli ubaleka mbethe,ehloniphekileyo ijaji eyintloko, nawo onke amalungu ahloniphekileyo ecandeloleenkundla.

eng: honourable ministers and deputy ministers,distinguished premiers and speakers of our provinces.
xho: kubaphathiswa abahloniphekileyo nakoosekela baphathiswa,kwiinkulumbuso ezihloniphekileyo noosomlomo bamaphondo.

eng: chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership.
xho: kusihlalo webhunga loomasipala basemzantsi afrika (i-salga), kunye nazo zonke iinkokheli zoorhulumente basekhaya.

eng: chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders.
xho: kwintloko zamaziko karhulumente axhasa intando yesininzi.

eng: the governor of the reserve bank,leaders from business, sports, traditional, religious and all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps, special and distinguished guests,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.
xho: kwirhuluneli yebhanki enguvimba,kwiinkokheli zezoshishino, zezemidlalo, zezemveli, zezenkolo nezawo onke amacandelo,kumalungu wezozakuzo, kwiindwendwe ezikhethekileyo nezibalulekileyo,kumalungu ahloniphekileyo,bemi zomzantsi afrikagood evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.

eng: i wish to thank the presiding officers for this opportunity to speak to the people of south africa, on this occasion of the last state of the nation address, of the fourth democratic administration.
xho: ndinqwenela ukubulela amagosa awongameleyo ngeli thuba lokuthetha nabantu basemzantsi afrika, kulo msitho wentetho kamongameli engobume besizwe (i-sona), yokugqibela kolu lawulo lwesine lwentando yesininzi.

eng: i would like to extend our deepest condolences on the passing of the late honourable mr ben skhosana, one of the longest serving and most senior members of this august house and our former minister of correctional services.
xho: ndithanda ukudlulisa amazwi wethu wovelwano olunzulu ngokushiywa kwethu ngongasekhoyo ohloniphekileyo umnu.

eng: we are truly saddened by his sudden passing.
xho: sibuhlungu kakhulu kukusishiya kwakhe ngesiquphe.

eng: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.
xho: sidlulisa uvelwano lwethu olunzulu kusapho lwakhe, nakwinkokheli ye-inkatha freedom party (i-ifp) ushenge, kunye nawo onke amalungu we-ifp.

eng: (we wish to extend our heartfelt condolences to his family and also to the ifp leader, shenge, as well as all the members of the ifp.
xho: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.

eng: )honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,this is the first state of the nation address to take place in the absence of our founding president, his excellency nelson rolihlahla mandela.
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyo,sihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncop,le yi-sona yokuqala eqhubeka engasekho umongameli owayengumseki wentando yesininzi yethu, ohloniphekileyo unelson rolihlahla mandela.

eng: his passing, on the eve of the 20th year of our freedom and democracy,caused untold pain to our people and beyond our borders.
xho: ukusishiya kwakhe, kanye xa sisecicini lokufika konyaka wama-20 wenkululeko yethu nolawulo lwentando yesininzi, kubangele intlungu enkulu kubantu bakuthi nangaphaya kwemida yethu.

eng: we find solace in the knowledge that madiba will live forever be in our hearts, and that we have a duty to take his legacy forward.
xho: sifumana ukuthuthuzeleka ezingqondweni kuba umadiba uzakuhlala ehleli ezintliziyweni zethu, kwaye sinoxanduva lokuba siqhubekeke ngomsebenzi wakhe.

eng: honourable members,our country has produced men and women of distinction, who have provided leadership during trying times.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyo,ilizwe lethu livelise amadoda namakhosikazi agqamileyo, athe abonakalise ubunkokheli ngamaxesha anzima.

eng: one such leader was mr moses kotane, former treasurer-general of the anc and former sacp general secretary.
xho: omnye wezo nkokheli yayingumnu moses kotane, owayesakuba ngunondyebo jikelele we-anc esakuba kwanguye nonobhala jikelele wombutho wamakomanisi womzantsi afrika (i-sacp).

eng: we are honouredto have his dear wife, mama rebecca kotane, as our special guest this evening.
xho: siwongekile kukuba nenkosikazi yakhe ethandekayo phakathi kwethu, umama urebecca kotane, njengendwendwe lethu elikhethekileyo ngobu busuku.

eng: mama kotane turned 102 years old yesterday, and we wish her all the best.
xho: umama ukotane ugqibe iminyaka eli-102 ubudala izolo, kwaye simnqwenelela okuhle kodwa.

eng: we also pay tribute to the former anc president mr oliver tambo, who kept the torch of freedom alive both at home and abroad during the most difficult times of our struggle.
xho: sikwakhumbula ngokunika imbeko owayesakuba ngumongameli we-anc umnu oliver tambo, owagcina isibane senkululeko siphila (ithemba lenkululeko liphila) apha ekhaya nakumazwe angaphesheya ngawona maxesha ayengawona anzima omzabalazo.

eng: his son, dali and his wife rachel are sharing this occasion with us this evening.
xho: unyana wakhe udali nenkosikazi yakhe urachel bayinxalenye yethu kulo msitho wangokuhlwa nje.

eng: we salute solomon mahlangu, a brave young man who went defiantly to the gallows in 1979 where he was executed at the age of 23. he said: “my blood will nourish the tree that will bear the fruits of freedom.
xho: sikhahlela usolomon mahlangu, iqhaji lomfana elaya ngokudela ekuxhonyweni ngowe-1979 apho wathi wabulawa ngokwesigwebo eminyaka ingama-23 ubudala.

eng: tell my people that i love them.
xho: nixelele abantu bam ukuba ndiyabathanda.

eng: we are honoured to host his mother, mama martha mahlangu and her grand-daughter bathabile.
xho: baze baqhubekeke ngokuzabalaza.”siwongekile kukusindleka umama wakhe, umama umartha mahlangu kunye nomzukulwana wakhe ubathabile.

eng: the year 2014 also marks the 40th anniversary of the cowardly murder through a parcel bomb, of student leader, abram onkgopotse tiro in 1974 in botswana.
xho: unyaka wama-2014 ukwaphawula isikhumbuzo sonyaka wama-40 wokugetyengwa ngobugwala ngesiqhushumbisi esiyipasile, kwenkokheli yabafundi, u-abram onkgopotse tiro ngowe-1974 ebotswana.

eng: we welcome his brother, mogomotsi tiro to this occasion.
xho: siyamamkela umntakwabo, umogomotsi tiro kulo msitho.

eng: we express the gratitude of the people, for his brother’s selfless sacrifice.
xho: sivakalisa umbulelo wabantu bakuthi, ngokuzenza idini komntakwabo engakhathalelanga siqu sakhe kuphela.

eng: we remember those who died in state-sponsored violence of the 1980s and 1990s in our townships and villages.
xho: siyabakhumbula abo bathi basweleka kubundlobongela obabufumana inkxaso yorhulumente weminyaka yama-1980 nama-1990 kwiilokishi zethu nasezilalini.

eng: ms jabu ndlovu, a former shopsteward of the national union of metalworkers of south africa (numsa), was gunned down in 1988 in pietermaritzburg together with her husband jabulani and their son.
xho: unks jabu ndlovu, owayesakuba ngummeli wabasebenzi wombutho wabasebenzi besinyithi wasemzantsi afrika (i-numsa), wadutyulwa wasweleka ngowe-1988 emgungundlovu kunye nomyeni ujabulani nonyana wakhe.

eng: we welcome her daughter luhle and son, sanele, and pay tribute to all families who lost their loved ones, across the political spectrum.
xho: siyayamkela intombi yakhe uluhle nonyana wayo, usanele, kwaye sidlulisela uvelwano lwethu olunzulu kuzo zonke iintsapho ezathe zaphulukana nabo bezibathanda, kuyo yonke imibutho yopolitiko.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,we were able to overcome all that pain of the past and build a new society.
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyo,sihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncop,sikwazile ukoyisa intlungu yangaphambili sakhe uluntu olutsha.

eng: we have built strong institutions of democracy.
xho: sakhe amaziko awomeleleyo wentando yesininzi.

eng: we buried the undemocratic, unrepresentative, oppressive and corrupt state that was serving a minority.
xho: siwungcwabile umbuso ongenalawulo lwentando yesininzi, ongamelanga luntu, wengcinezelo nogcwele lurhwaphilizo owawusebenzela iimfuno zegcuntswana kuphela.

eng: we formed a unitary, non-racial, non-sexist democratic state, answerable to and representative of all south africans.
xho: siqulunqe urhulumente obumbeneyo wamaqela ngamaqela, ongenacalucalulo ngokobuhlanga, nangokwesini wolawulo lwentando yesininzi, obizwa asabele nomele bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika.

eng: we created a thriving constitutional democracy, with well-functioning arms of the state –the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.
xho: sidale ulawulo lwentando yesininzi olusekelezelwe kumgaqo-siseko, olunemilenze esebenza ngokubonakalayo yombuso – izindlu zowiso-mithetho, ikhabhinethi neejaji zeenkundla.

eng: we have chapter 9 institutions which support democracy and protect the rights of citizens.¬liberation and democracy have also created space for an active civil society and a free media.
xho: sinamaziko abizwa ngokuba ngamaziko esahluko se-9 axhasa ulawulo lwentando yesininzi aze akhusele amalungelo wabemi.

eng: liberation also brought for the first time, the promise of gender equality.
xho: inkululeko nolawulo lwentando yesininzi lukwadale amathuba oluntu olusebenzayo nenkululeko yamajelo eendaba.

eng: the representation of women in public institutions has increased considerably since the dawn of freedom, and the extension of basic services also benefits women.
xho: inkululeko okokuqala ikwasiphathele, ithemba lomakulingwane ngokwesini.

eng: all these attributes have made south africa a much better place to live in now than it has ever been.
xho: zonke ezi mpawu zenze umzantsi afrika ube lelona lizwe lingcono onokuhlala kulo kunokuba kwakunjalo.

eng: however, our country still faces the triple challenge of poverty, inequality and unemployment, which we continue to grapple with.
xho: nangona kunjalo, ilizwe lethu lisajongene nomngeni ontlandlo-ntathu wendlala, ukungalingani nentswela-ngqesho, esisaqhubekayo ukusokola ngazo.

eng: dealing with these challenges has become a central focus of all democratic administrations.
xho: ukuqubisana nale mingeni kube yeyona nto bonke oorhulumente bentando yesininzi bagxile kuyo.

eng: we elected to focus on five priorities, education, health, the fight against crime and corruption, rural development and land reform as well as creating decent work.
xho: sikhethe ukugxila kwimiba ephambili emihlanu, ezemfundo, ezempilo, ukulwa nolwaphulo-mthetho norhwaphilizo, uphuhliso lwamaphandle nokuhlengahlengiswa komhlaba kwakunye nokudala amathuba emisebenzi endilisekileyo.

eng: we also reorganised the state to improve performance.
xho: sikwahlengahlengise nombuso ukuba ukuphucula indlela osebenza ngayo.

eng: we created two key functions, long term planning as well as monitoring and evaluation.
xho: sidale imisebenzi emibini engundoqo, isicwangciso sexesha elide kwakunye nohlolo novavanyo.

eng: we established the national planning commission which produced the landmark national development plan, the country’s socio-economic blueprint and one of the major achievements of this fourth administration.
xho: saseka ikhomishoni yocwangciso yesizwe nethe yavelisa isicwangciso sophuhliso sesizwe esibe sisiganeko esibalulekileyo, isicwangciso sezentlalo noqoqosho kweli lizwe nesikwayenye yeempumelelo ezingundoqo zolawulo lorhulumente wesine.

eng: the plan outlines what we should do to eradicate poverty, increase employment and reduce inequality by 2030. our monitoring and evaluation indicates that many services continue to improve.
xho: esi sicwangciso siyacacisa ukuba kufanele senze ntoni na ukuncothula indlala, ukwandisa amathuba emisebenzi nokunciphisa ukungalingani ungekafiki owama-2030.

eng: for example, social grants and identity documents now take a shorter time to be processed.
xho: uhlolo novavanyo lwethu lusibonisa ukuba iinkonzo ezininzi ziyaqhubekeka ukuphucuka.

eng: but many others still require further work.
xho: kodwa ezinye ezininzi zisafuna ukusetyenzwa.

eng: i will report back on the five priorities, starting with the economy.
xho: ndiza kufaka ingxelo ngale miba mihlanu ingundoqo, ndiqale ngezoqoqosho.

eng: on average, the economy has grown at 3,2 percent a year from 1994 to 2012 despite the global recession which claimed a million jobs.
xho: ngokomyinge, uqoqosho lukhule kangange-3,2 seepesenti ngonyaka ukususela kowe-1994 ukuya kowama-2012 nangona kubekho ukudodobala koqoqosho okubangele izigidi zabantu baphulukane nemisebenzi.

eng: working together as government, business, labour and the community sector, we nursed the economy to a recovery.
xho: ngentsebenziswano phakathi kukarhulumente, abezoshishino, imibutho yezabasebenzi nemibutho emele uluntu, siluthantamisile uqoqosho ukuba lubuyele esiqhelweni.

eng: the national wealth, measured in terms of gdp, has grown to more than 3.5 trillion rand.
xho: ubutyebi besizwe jikelele, xa bulinganiswa ngokwemveliso yangaphakathi epheleleyo, bukhule bade bedlula kwi-3,5 seetriliyoni zeerandi.

eng: jobs are now being created again.
xho: amathuba emisebenzi ayadalwa kwakhona.

eng: there are now 15 million people with jobs in the country, the highest ever in our history, and over 650 thousand jobs were created last year, according to stats sa.
xho: bali-15 lezigidi abantu abaphangelayo apha kweli lizwe, elona nani liphezulu kwimbali yethu, kwaye kudalwe amathuba emisebenzi engaphezulu kwama-650 000 kulo nyaka uphelileyo, ngokutsho kweziko leenkcukhacha-manani lasemzantsi afrika.

eng: this is still not good enough.
xho: kodwa ke oko akwanelanga.

eng: the unemployment rate still remains high.
xho: izinga lentswela-ngqesho lisephezulu.

eng: youth unemployment in south africa continues to be of concern, as it is throughout the world.
xho: intswela-ngqesho kulutsha emzantsi afrika isaxhalabisa nangoku, njengoko kunjalo nasehlabathini jikelele.

eng: we are taking a number of measures, including the employment tax incentive act which encourages employers to hire younger workers.
xho: sinamanyathelo aliqela esiwathathayo, kuquka nomthetho werhafu yenkuthazo yezengqesho okhuthaza abaqeshi ukuba baqeshe abasebenzi abalulutsha.

eng: regulations will be passed to ensure that this does not affect unsubsidized or older workers adversely.
xho: kuza kuphunyezwa imithetho ukuqinisekisa ukuba oku akubachaphazeli kakubi abasebenzi abangafumani nkxaso yamali okanye abadala.

eng: further measures are contained in the national youth accord that was signed in soweto last april.
xho: amanye amanyathelo aqulathwe kwisivumelwano solutsha sesizwe esatyikitywa esoweto kwekatshazimpunzi yonyaka odlulileyo.

eng: the expanded public works programme and the community work programme continue to be an effective cushion for the poor and the youth.
xho: inkqubo yemisebenzi yoluntu enatysiweyo kunye nenkqubo yemisebenzi yoluntu isaqhubekeka ukuyinciphisa ngokuvakalayo intswela-ngqesho kwabahluphekileyo nolutsha.

eng: we have created 3,7 million work opportunities over the past five years.
xho: sidale amathuba emisebenzi engaphezulu kwe-3, 7 sezigidi kule minyaka mihlanu idlulieyo.

eng: our people obtain an income and skills from the public works programme, which they use to seek formal employment.
xho: abantu bethu bafumana ingeniso nezakhono kwinkqubo yemisebenzi yoluntu, abathi bazisebenzise ekufuneni imisebenzi esesikweni.

eng: cabinet has set a target of 6 million work opportunities from this year to 2019, targeting the youth.
xho: ikhabhinethi izimisele umlinganiselo wokudala amathuba emisebenzi ezizigidi ezisithandathu ukususela kulo nyaka ukuya kowama-2019, apho kuza kugxilwa kulutsha.

eng: our social assistance programme which now reaches about 16 million people, provides a safety for millions, especially vulnerable children.
xho: inkqubo yesibonelelo sethu sezentlalo esifikelela kubantu abamalunga nezigidi ezili-16, inika ukhuselo kwizigidi, ingakumbi abantwana abasemngciphekweni.

eng: (many households are benefiting from government grants which are child support grants, pension as well as disability grants.
xho: imizi emininzi iyancedakala ngenxa yezibonelelo zikarhulumente, inkxaso-mali yabantwana, indodla yabadala neyabakhubazekileyo.

eng: (government will continue paying out these grants because many households highly depend on them since job opportunities are scarce during these trying times of an economic downturn.
xho: ezi zibonelelo zizokuhlala ziqhubekeka kuba ziluncedo kwimizi emininzi kuba amathuba emisebenzi avela kancinci kweli xesha lokudodobala koqoqosho.

eng: (these opportunities, which are made available by government, are enabling us to proudly say that we are currently living in a country that is far better compared to the one we lived in before 1994.
xho: la mathuba afumanekayo kurhulumente, asenza ukuba sitsho ngeqhayiya ukuthi, umzantsi afrika esiphila kuwo namhlanje, ungcono kakhulu kunalowo sasiphila kuwo ngaphambi kowe-1994.

eng: )compatriots,we are still going through a difficult period.
xho: bantu bakuthi,sisekwixesha elinzima.

eng: developments in the united states economy have led to a rapid depreciation in the emerging market currencies, including the rand.
xho: iimeko zoqoqosho lwasemelika zikhokelele ekuhleni ngamandla kwemali yorwebo lwamazwe asakhulayo, kuquka nerandi.

eng: during the course of 2013, the rand depreciated by 17.6 per cent against the us dollar.
xho: ngexesha lowama-2013, irandi yehla nge-17,6 leepesenti xa ithelekiswa nedola yasemelika.

eng: the weaker exchange rate poses a significant risk to inflation and will also make our infrastructure programme more expensive.
xho: izinga lokurwebiselana elibuthathaka liqulathe umngcipheko omkhulu kumandla erandi kwaye kuza kwenza nenkqubo yethu yeziseko ezingundoqo ibize kakhulu.

eng: however, export companies, particularly in the manufacturing sector, should take advantage of the weaker rand and the stronger global recovery.
xho: noxa kunjalo, iinkampani ezithumela imveliso yazo kumazwe angaphesheya, ingakumbi kwicandelo lokuvelisa, kufanele zibusebenzisele ukuzinceda ubuthathaka berandi nokuphucuka koqoqosho ngamandla ehlabathini jikelele.

eng: while we have these difficulties, we know that we can cope with this period of turbulence.
xho: ngeli xesha sinezinzima, siyayiqonda into yokuba singamelana nalo eli xesha lokungazinzi.

eng: we have done so before in the past five years.
xho: sasikwenzile oko ngaphambili kule minyaka mihlanu igqithileyo.

eng: we will, in fact, emerge stronger if we do the right things.
xho: phofu, siza kukulalisa ngophothe ukuba ngaba senza okufanelekileyo.

eng: we have to work together as government, business and labour to grow our economy at rates that are above 5 per cent to be able to create the jobs we need.
xho: kufanele sisebenzisane njengorhulumente, abezoshishino nemibutho yabasebenzi ukukhulisa uqoqosho lwethu ngezinga elingaphezulu kweepesenti ezihlanu sikwazi ukudala amathuba emisebenzi esiyidingayo.

eng: fortunately this collaboration is already taking place.
xho: ngethamsanqa le ntsebenziswano seyiqalisile.

eng: it is taking place at nedlac which is one of the key institutions of cooperation in our democracy, between government, business, labour and the community sector.
xho: oko kwenzeka kwibhunga lesizwe lokuphuhlisa uqoqosho nezabasebenzi (i-nedlac) elingamanye wamaziko entsebenziswano kulawulo lwethu lwentando yesininzi, phakathi kukarhulumente, abezoshishino, imibutho emele abasebenzi nabameli babahlali.

eng: it has taken place as well in engagements that we have been having with the business community.
xho: iqhubekekile kwakunye nakuthethathethwano ebesinalo nabezoshishino.

eng: last year i started engaging business on specific steps that government can take to make it easier to do business in our country.
xho: kulo nyaka uphelileyo ndiye ndathethathethana nabezoshishino ngamanyathelo athile anokuthathwa ngurhulumente ukwenza kube lula ngakumbi ukwenza ushishino kweli lizwe lethu.

eng: arising out of that process, we have now streamlined regulatory and licensing approvals for environmental impact assessments, water licenses and mining licenses.
xho: okuye kwavela kulo nkqubo, sikuhlengahlengisile ukuphunyezwa kwemithetho nokwenziwa kwempepha-mvume kuhlolo lwempembelelo kwindalo, ukukhutshwa kwempepha-mvume yamanzi nempepha-mvume yimigodi.

eng: parliament is finalizing amendments to the law to give effect to this very positive development, which will cut to under 300 days, the time it takes to start a mine, from application to final approvals.
xho: ipalamente iqukumbela izihlomelo kulo mthetho ukwenzela ukuba la manyathelo athembisayo asebenze, into ke leyo ezakucutha iintsuku ezithathwayo ukuvula umgodi, zibe ngaphantsi kwezingama-300, ukususela ekufakweni kwesicelo ukuya ekuphunyezweni kwaso.

eng: the deputy president of the republic continues to facilitate discussions between government, mining companies and labour.
xho: usekela mongameli werhiphabliki usaqhubekeka ukuququzelela iingxoxo phakathi kukarhulumente, iinkampani zemigodi nemibutho emele abasebenzi.

eng: the purpose is to stabilise industrial relations in this very important sector of our economy.
xho: iinjongo zezokuzinzisa ubudlelwane kweli candelo libaluleke kangaka loqoqosho lwethu.

eng: the process is yielding results.
xho: le nkqubo ivelisa iziphumo noko.

eng: strikes in the sector were fewer and shorter last year.
xho: zibe mbalwa nazifutshane izehlo zoqhankqalazo kweli candelo kulo nyaka uphelileyo.

eng: and more importantly, industrial relations processes are taking place in a manner consistent with the law.
xho: kwaye okona kubaluleke kakhulu, iinkqubo zobudlelwane kwezoshishino ziqhuba ngendlela engqinelanayo nomthetho.

eng: we have intervened in mining because it is one of our key job drivers.
xho: singenelele kwezemigodi kuba ingamanye amacandelo wethu angundoqo ekudaleni amathuba emisebenzi.

eng: we need a mining sector that works.
xho: sidinga icandelo lezemigodi elisebenzayo.

eng: mining employs over half a million people.
xho: imigodi iqesha abantu abangaphezulu kwesiqingatha sesigidi.

eng: it is the biggest earner of foreign exchange in our country.
xho: lilelona lizuza ingeniso enkulu kunaniselwano namazwe angaphandle kwilizwe lethu.

eng: it also contributes about 20 billion rand directly to the tax revenue.
xho: ikwa negalelo elimalunga nama-r20 eebhiliyoni eliya ngqo kwingeniso yerhafu.

eng: mining also makes a far larger contribution as a buyer of goods and services, and a supplier of inputs to other sectors of our economy and other economies around the globe.
xho: imigodi yenza igalelo elikhulu kakhulu njengomthengi wezinto ngeenkonzo, kunye nomboneleli wegalelo kwamanye amacandelo oqoqosho lwethu kunye noqoqosho lwamanye amazwe ehlabathini jikelele.

eng: we are exploring partnerships with stakeholders to address the issue of housing in mining towns.
xho: sisaqwalasela ubudlelwane bokuhlangabezana nomba wezindlu kwidolophu ezikufutshane nemigodi nabadlala indima ebalulekileyo.

eng: let me also remind mining companies that 2014 is the deadline for them to improve housing and living conditions of mineworkers and to achieve a number of targets.
xho: mandikhumbuze iinkampani zemigodi ukuba unyaka wama-2014 ngowokugqibela wokuba mabaphucule izindlu neemeko abasebenzi-mgodini abaphila phansi kwazo nokuphumeza inani lwezinto ekufanele ziphunyeziwe.

eng: government continues to monitor and enforce compliance on both the company’s social and labour plans and mining charter targets.
xho: urhulumente uza kuqhubekeka ukuhlola nokunyanzelisa ukuthotyelwa kuzo zimbini izimiselo zezicwangciso zezentlalo nezabasebenzi nomqulu wezemigodi.

eng: fellow south africans,honourable members,other than mining, we had identified five other job drivers in 2009. these are tourism, agriculture, the green economy, infrastructure development and manufacturing.
xho: bemi bomzantsi afrika,malungu ahloniphekileyo,ngaphandle nje kwemigodi, siye sabona amanye amacandelo amahlanu angabadali bamathuba emisebenzi ngowama-2009.

eng: the tourism industry has grown dramatically.
xho: ishishini lezokhenketho likhule ngokuncomekayo.

eng: in 1993, south africa received a mere 3 million foreign visitors.
xho: ngowe-1993, umzantsi afrika ufumene nje izigidi ezintathu zeendwendwe ezisuka kumazwe angaphesheya.

eng: by 2012, the figure had grown to 13 million visitors.
xho: ngowama-2012, inani likhule lade lafika kwiindwendwe ezizigidi ezili-13.

eng: we will continue to grow this industry, given its potential for job creation.
xho: siza kuqhubekeka ukulikhulisa eli shishini, xa siqwalasele amandla walo okudala amathuba emisebenzi.

eng: in 2012 we unveiled the national infrastructure plan, led by the president through the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission.
xho: ngowama-2012 sityhile isicwangciso seziseko ezingundoqo sesizwe, ngokukhokelwa ngumongameli ngekhomishini kamongameli yokulungelelanisa iziseko ezingundoqo.

eng: we have subsequently invested one trillion rand in public infrastructure over the past five years.
xho: emva koko sityale itriliyoni enye yeerandi kwiziseko ezingundoqo zoluntu kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo.

eng: many of the projects are completed or are nearing completion.
xho: uninzi lweziprojekthi zigqityiwe okanye seziza kugqitywa.

eng: i will mention just a few.
xho: ndiza kukhankanya nje zibe mbalwa.

eng: the rea vaya system in joburg is now used by more than 100 000 gauteng residents.
xho: inkqubo ye-rea vaya yaserhawutini ngoku isetyenziswa ngabahlali basegauteng abangaphezulu kwe-100 000. inkqubo ekwanjalo isakhiwa ekapa, etshwane, enelson mandela bay, kwisixeko sase-buffalo, ethekwini nase-rustenburg.

eng: similar systems are being built in cape town, tshwane, nelson mandela bay, buffalo city, ethekwini and rustenburg.
xho: amazibuko needolophu ezinamazibuko zeli lizwe ziphuculiwe.

eng: we have built a 700 kilometre fuel pipeline from durban to gauteng to transport 4 billion cubic litres of petrol, diesel and jet fuel a year.
xho: sifakele uluhlu lwemibhobho yezibaso engama-700 eekhilomitha ukusuka ethekwini ukuya egauteng yokuthutha iibhiliyoni ezine zeekyubhik-litha zepetula, idizili kunye nezibaso zejeti ngonyaka.

eng: close to 1 500 kilometres of new roads or lanes have been built.
xho: sekwakhiwe iindlela ezintsha okanye imizila ephantse yafika kwi-1500 leekhilomitha.

eng: this progress in respect of roads reminds us of those who have served in this government before who wanted the best for the country, such as our former transport minister mr dullar omar.
xho: le nkqubela ngokumalunga neendlela isikhumbuzo ngabo babesebenza kulo rhulumente ngaphambi kwethu ababefuna ukuba eli lizwe lifumane okungcono kodwa, abafana nowayesakuba ngumphathiswa wezothutho umnu dullar omar.

eng: his dear wife farieda is one of our guests this evening.
xho: inkosikazi yakhe ufarieda ngomnye weendwendwe zethu ezibalulekileyo ngobu busuku.

eng: the construction of new rail lines has started in mpumalanga, to ease the pressure off the roads.
xho: ukwakhiwa komzila woololiwe empumalanga sekuqalile, ngeenjongo zokunciphisa uxinizelelo ezindleleni.

eng: the gautrain project is now fully functional and carries over 1,2 million passengers a month.
xho: iprojekthi yegautrain isebenza ngokupheleleyo ngoku kwaye ithwala abakhweli abangaphezulu kwe-1,2 sezigidi ngenyanga.

eng: the passenger rail agency of south africa will spend over 120 billion rand over the next 10 years to buy new trains.
xho: i-arhente yabakhweli bakaloliwe yasemzantsi afrika (i-prasa) iza kuchitha ngaphezulu kwe-r120 leebhiliyoni kule minyaka ilishumi izayo ukuthenga oololiwe abatsha.

eng: transnet is implementing its massive 300 billion rand market demand strategy, building much needed transport infrastructure.
xho: abakwa-transnet baphumeza isicwangciso-qhinga sabo esifunekayo sama-r300 eebhiliyoni, ngokwakha iziseko ezingundoqo zezothutho ezidingeka ngamandla.

eng: to realise the economic potential of the western cape and the west coast, we launched the saldanha industrial development zone and opened two new factories in atlantis.
xho: ngokuqonda amandla wezoqoqosho wentshona koloni nonxweme lwasentshona, simisele ummandla wophuhliso lwamashishini i-saldanha saze savula nemizi-mveliso emibini emitsha e-atlantis.

eng: to improve the water supply, two large new dams were completed, de hoop in limpopo and spring grove in kwazulu-natal, while phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project is to be launched soon.
xho: ukuphucula ubonelelo lwamanzi, sele egqityiwe ukwakhiwa amadama amabini amatsha, i-de hoop elimpopo ne-spring grove kwazulu-natal, ngeli xesha isigaba sesibini seprojekthi ilesotho highlands water iza kumiselwa kungekudala.

eng: construction is continuing at the new power stations, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga and ingula near ladysmith, employing more than 30 000 workers.
xho: ulwakhiwo lwezikhululo zombane ezitsha ezibini lusaqhubekeka, imedupi elimpopo, ikusile empumalanga ne-ingula kufutshane nomnambithi, kwaqeshwa abasebenzi abangaphezulu kwama-30 000. sisaqhubekeka ukuphonononga eminye imithombo yezamandla, ngokuhambelana nesicwangciso semithombo edibeneyo yezamandla.

eng: we continue to explore other sources of energy, in line with the integrated resource plan for energy.
xho: ukuphuhliswa kwepetroliyam, ingakumbi igesi ephuma kuqhushumbo olwenzeka phantsi komhlaba kungaguqula izinto kummandla wekaroo noqoqosho lwasemzantsi afrika.

eng: the development of petroleum, especially shale gas will be a game-changer for the karoo region and the south african economy.
xho: siyihlolile imingcipheko namathuba, imithetho yokugqibela iza kuqukunjelwa kungekudala ize ilandelwe ngokwenziwa nokukhutshwa kweempepha-mvume.

eng: we expect to conclude the procurement of nine thousand six hundred megawatts of nuclear energy.
xho: silindele ukuqukumbela ukufumaneka kwama-9 600 ee-megawatts zamandla enyukliya.

eng: biofuels manufacturers have been selected and have started work.
xho: abavelisi bezibaso ezivela kwizityalo sele bekhethiwe kwaye sele beqalisile ukusebenza.

eng: honourable membersours is indeed a country at work and is a much better place to live in.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyoeneneni elethu lilizwe elisebenzayo kwaye yindawo ekungconwanana ukuhlala kuyo.

eng: we must keep the momentum.
xho: kufuneka silugcine olo yondelelwano lwamandla.

eng: honourable members,more of our wealth is created through the internet or telecommunication.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyo,uninzi lobutyebi bethu budalwa ngokusebenzisa i-intanethi okanye unxibelelwano lomnxeba.

eng: a 37 000 kilometres of fibre-optic cable has been laid by the private and public sectors in the past five years.
xho: kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo kufakelwe iintambo zombane ezinezigqubuthelo zeplastiki ezingama-37 000 eekhilomitha.

eng: this will be significantly expanded in the years ahead.
xho: oko kuza kwandiswa ngokuvakalayo kule minyaka siya kuyo.

eng: we are proud of our successes in science and technology.
xho: siyazingca ngempumelelo yethu kwezenzululwazi nobuchwephetshe.

eng: the construction of the first telescope of the 64-dish forerunner to the square kilometre array, the meerkat, will be completed in the first quarter of 2014. honourable members,our incentives to boost manufacturing have yielded returns.
xho: ukwakhiwa kwesibonakude sokuqala sama-64 eedish ephambili ye-square kilometre array, i-meerkat, kuza kugqitywa kwikota yokuqala yowama-2014.

eng: the automotive investment scheme that was launched in 2009 has approved a total 3.8 billion rand worth of incentives for about 160 investment projects.
xho: iskimu senkuthazo kwezeemoto nesamiselwa ngowama-2009 sesiphumeze inkuthazo efikelela kwi-r3,8 yeebhiliyoni ukwenzela iiprojekthi zotyalo-mali ezili-160.

eng: these sustain more than 50 thousand jobs.
xho: oku kuzinzise malunga namathuba emisebenzi engama-50 wamawaka.

eng: the companies will be developing sedan cars, minibus taxis and buses.
xho: ezi nkampani ziza kwenza iimoto ezincinci, iteksi zeminibhasi neebhasi.

eng: we have stabilised the clothing, textile, leather and footwear sector, which had been shedding jobs.
xho: silizinzisile icandelo lezeempahla, impahla elukiweyo, ufele nelezihlangu, apho abantu babekade bephelelwa yimisebenzi.

eng: several industries have been designated for local content.
xho: amashishini athile amiselwe ukuba ajongane nemveliso yalapha ekhaya.

eng: these include buses, canned vegetables, clothing, textiles, leather and footwear and other goods.
xho: oku kuquka iibhasi, iimfuno enkonkxiweyo, impahla, impahla elukiweyo, ufele nezihlangu nezinye iimveliso.

eng: we have concrete examples of the success of the localisation programme.
xho: sinemizekelo ebonakalayo yokuphumelela kwenkqubo yokuqaqambisa imveliso yasekhaya.

eng: in the past two years alone, more than 20 000 minibus taxis and 330 buses were assembled locally, drawing investment and development to our cities.
xho: kule minyaka mibini idlulileyo, kudityaniswe iiteksi zeminibhasi ezingama-20 000 neebhasi ezingama-330 apha ekhaya, oku kutsalela utyalo-mali nophuhliso kwizixeko zethu.

eng: in the next five years, the state will procure at least 75% of its goods and services from south african producers.
xho: kule minyaka mihlanu izayo, urhulumente uza kuthenga malunga nama-75% eemveliso neenkonzo kubavelisi balapha emzantsi afrika.

eng: fellow south africans,we have to work more intensively to develop emerging or black industrialists.
xho: bemi bomzantsi afrika,kufanele sisebenze ngaphezulu kokuba sisenza ukuphuhlisa imizi-mveliso esakhulayo okanye abanini mizi-mveliso abantsundu.

eng: many of the aspirant black industrialists complain about the difficulties they experience in obtaining industrial finance, supplier and retail markets, and technical production support.
xho: uninzi lwabanini mizi-mveliso abamnyama abasakhulayo bakhalazela ubunzima abahlangana nabo ekufumaneni inkxaso yezezimali zoshishini lwemizi-mveliso, urhwebo lwababoneleli nabathengisa ngemiyinge emincinci, nenkxaso yobuchwephetshe bokuvelisa.

eng: the national empowerment fund, the industrial development corporation and the small enterprise finance agency will continue to provide finance to viable black-owned businesses to promote industrialisation.
xho: ingxowa-mali yokuxhobisa yesizwe, nequmrhu lophuhliso lwamashishini kunye ne-arhente yenkxaso-mali yamashishini amancinane ziza kuqhubekeka ukubonelela ngemali yenkxaso kumashishini wemizi-mveliso aphilayo wabanini abantsundu ukukhuthaza ukwanda kwamashishini emizi-mveliso.

eng: in addition, we encourage established businesses to support the development of black industrial businesses.
xho: ukongeza apho, sikhuthaza amashishini azinzileyo ukuba axhase uphuhliso lwamashishini emizi-mveliso yabantsundu.

eng: agriculture is a key job driver and a provider of opportunities for entrepreneurship.
xho: ezolimo ngumdali wamathuba emisebenzi ongundoqo nomboneleli wamathuba ezoshishino.

eng: our agricultural support programme, fetsa tlala, is producing brand new exporters.
xho: inkqubo yethu yenkxaso yezolimo, i-fetsa tlala, ivelisa abathumeli-mveliso kumazwe angaphesheya abatsha.

eng: the first 88 smallholder farmers in this programme supplied the united nations world food programme with 268 tons of maize and beans to send to lesotho last month.
xho: awokuqala amafama angama-88 wemihlatyana emincinci kule nkqubo abonelele inkqubo yokutya yehlabathi yezizwe ezimanyeneyo ngeetoni ezingama-268 zombona neembotyi zokuthumela elesotho kule nyanga iphelileyo.

eng: we expect this number to increase.
xho: silindele ukuba eli nani lande.

eng: we will continue to promote our fisheries sector as well, which contributes an estimated 6billion rand to the economy and provides 27 000 jobs.
xho: siza kuqhubekeka ukulikhulisa nalo icandelo lethu lezokuloba, nelithi libe negalelo elithelekelelwa kwiibhiliyoni ezisithandathu zeerandi kuqoqosho nelibonelela ngamathuba emisebenzi engama-27 000. malungu ahloniphekileyo,senze inkqubela entle kwinkqubo yokuhlengahlengiswa komhlaba.

eng: since 1994, nearly 5,000 farms, comprising 4.2 million hectares, have been transferred to black people, benefiting over 200,000 families.
xho: ukususela ngowe-1994, phantse ziifama ezingama-5 000, ezenziwa ziihektare, ezidluliselwe kubantu abantsundu, ezixhamlise iintsapho ezingaphezulu kwama-200 000. phantse ibe ngamabango omhlaba angama-80 000, afikelela kwi-3,4 sezigidi zeehektare, asele egqityiwe kwaye kuxhamle i-1,8 sezigidi zabantu.

eng: nearly 80,000 land claims, totaling 3.4 million hectares, have been settled and 1.8 million people have benefited.
xho: urhulumente olandelayo kuza kufuneka ukuba uqhubele phambili ngenani elivisayo lemigaqo-nkqubo, ungenelelo lwezomthetho nolubonakalayo, ukuqhubela phambili ukulungisa ukuhluthwa komhlaba kubantu bethu.

eng: the next administration will need to take forward a number of policy, legislative and practical interventions, to further redress the dispossession of our people of their land.
xho: oku kuquka imiba enxulumene nokusekwa kwe-ofisi yomhlengahlengisi jikelele ngalo ndlela kuvulwe inyoba yokufakwa kwamabango.

eng: honourable memberssouth africa is indeed a much better place to live in.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyoeneneni umzantsi afrika lilizwe elithe chatha ngobungcono ukuhlala kulo.

eng: let me now report on our social transformation programme.
xho: ke ngoku makhe ndifake ingxelo ngenkqubo yenguqu kwezentlalo.

eng: education is a ladder out of poverty for millions of our people.
xho: imfundo yindlela yokuphuma endlaleni kwizigidi ngezigidi zabantu.

eng: we are happy therefore that there is a huge increase in the enrolment of children in school, from pre-primary to tertiary level.
xho: ngoko ke sinovuyo kukubona ukwanda okukhulu ekubhalisweni kwabantwana ezikolweni, ukususela kwezesigaba esingaphambi kweprayimari ukuya kwizinga lezemfundo ephakamileyo.

eng: the number of children attending grade r has more than doubled, moving from about 300 thousand to more than 700 thousand between 2003 and 2011. a draft policy framework towards universal access to grade r has been gazetted for public comment, with a view to making grade r compulsory.
xho: inani labantwana abaku-greydi r liphindaphindene ngokugqithisileyo, lisuka kubantwana abamalunga nama-300 000 ukuya ngaphezulu kwama-700 000 phakathi kowama-2003 ukuya kowama-2011.

eng: (eight million learners are attending no-fee schools, whereas nine million learners are getting nutritious meals at school, which are provided by government to ensure that they do not suffer from starvation and that enables them to perform well.
xho: bantu bakuthi,abantwana abazizigidi ezisibhozo abahlawuli ezikolweni, kanti abazizigidi ezilithoba bafumana ukutya okusempilweni ezikolweni okuphuma kurhulumente, ukuze bafunde kakuhle bangafi yindlala.

eng: )the matric pass rate has gone up from around 61 percent in 2009 to 78 percent last year and the bachelor passes improve each year.
xho: izinga lokuphumelela kwimatriki liyenyuka ukususela malunga nama-61% ngowama-2009 ukuya kuma-78% kulo nyaka uphelileyo kwaye nokuphumelela kwabemfundo yezidanga kuyaphucuka qho ngonyaka.

eng: through the annual national assessments, we keep track of improvements and interventions needed, especially, in maths and science.
xho: ngohlolo lonyaka-nonyaka lwesizwe, sihlala sikwazi ukubona ukuphucuka namangenelelo adingekayo, ingakumbi, kwizibalo nenzululwazi.

eng: to promote inclusivity and diversity, the south african sign language curriculum will be offered in schools from next year, 2015. we have increased our numbers of literate adults through the kha ri gude programme from 2,2 million in 2008 to 3 million people.
xho: ukukhulisa ukuquka konke nokwahlukana, ikharikyulam yolwimi lwezandla lwasemzantsi afrika luza kufundiswa ezikolweni ukususela kulo nyaka uzayo, wama-2015.

eng: we have also been investing in teacher training and are re-opening teacher training colleges to meet the demand.
xho: sikwatyale imali kuqeqesho lweetitshala nokuvulwa kwakhona kweekholeji zootitshala ukukwazi ukuhlangabezana noko kudingekayo.

eng: to produce a decent learning environment, we have delivered 370 new schools replacing mud schools and other unsuitable structures around the country.
xho: ukuvelisa indawo yokufundela endilisekileyo, sinikezele ngezikolo ezingama-370 ezitsha ezithatha indawo yezikolo zodaka nezinye izakhiwo ezingafanelekanga elizweni jikelele.

eng: the programme continues.
xho: le nkqubo isaqhubekeka.

eng: compatriotswe have a good story to tell in higher education as well.
xho: bantu bakuthi,kuhle esinokukubalisa nakwimfundo ephakamileyo.

eng: student enrolments at universities increased by 12% while further education and training college enrolments have increased by 90%.
xho: ukubhaliswa kwabafundi kwidyunivesithi kwande nge-12% ngeli xesha ukubhalisa kwiikholeji zokwandisa imfundo noqeqesho (ii-fet) kwande ngama-90%.

eng: we have increased the budgets of the national student financial aid scheme to 9 billion rand to meet the rising demand.
xho: silwandisile uhlahlo-lwabiwo mali lweskimu soncedo lwezezimali sabafundi sesizwe saya kutsho kwiibhiliyoni ezilithoba ukuhlangabezana nokudingeka okukhula ngamandla.

eng: another major achievement of this term has been the establishment of two brand new universities, sol plaatje in the northern cape and the university of mpumalanga.
xho: esinye seziphumo ezigundoqo kweli xesha ibe kukusekwa kweedyunivesithi ezimbini ezintsha kraca, i-sol plaatjie emntla koloni kunye nedyunivesithi yasempumalanga.

eng: we will also build 12 new fet colleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal and eastern cape.
xho: sizokwakha neekholeji zee-fet ezili-12 elimpopo, empumalanga, kwazulu-natal nasempuma koloni.

eng: compatriots,the launch of the national education collaboration framework last year was an important development for the country.
xho: bantu bakuthi,ukumiselwa kwenkqubo-sikhokelo yentsebenziswano kwezemfundo yesizwe kulo nyaka uphelileyo ibe linyathelo elibaluleke kakhulu kweli lizwe.

eng: we wish the team well in their national duty.
xho: eli qela silinqwenela okuhle kodwa kumsebenzi walo wesizwe.

eng: compatriots,we have a good story to tell in the improvement of health care too.
xho: bantu bakuthi,kuhle esinokubalisa nangokuphucuka kwenkathalelo yethu yezempilo.

eng: over the past five years, 300 new health facilities have been built, including 160 new clinics.
xho: kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo, kwakhiwe amaziko ezempilo angama-300, kuquka neekliniki ezintsha ezi-160.

eng: ten new hospitals have been builtor refurbished in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg district, swartruggens, khayelitsha and mitchell’s plain.
xho: kwakhiwe izibhedlele ezilishumi ezitsha okanye ezinye zavuselelwa e-ladybrand,e-germiston, emamelodi, e-natalspruit, ethekwini, ezola, ebojanala, kwisithili sase-vryburg, e-swartruggens.

eng: honourable speakerhonourable chairperson of the ncopthe hiv and aids turnaround is one of the biggest achievements of this administration and we are used as a model country by the united nations aids programmes, (unaids).
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyosihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncopinguqu kwintsholongwane kagawulayo (i-hiv) nogawulayo (i-aids) yenye yeempumelelo ezinkulu zalo rhulumente kwaye sisetyenziswa njengelizwe elinguvulindlela yinkqubo yoncedo lukagawulayo yezizwe ezimanyeneyo, (i-unaids).

eng: mother to child transmission of hiv has declined sharply and we have doubled the number of people who are receiving anti-retroviral treatment, from one million to 2.4 million people in 2013. more than 20 million south africans have taken the hiv test since the launch of the campaign in 2011 which indicates confidence in the health system.
xho: usuleleko lwe-hiv phakathi kosana nonina luhle kakhulu kwaye siliphindaphindile inani labantu abafumana unyango lwamachiza okuthomolalisa intsholongwane kagawulayo (ii-arv), ukususela kwisigidi esinye ukuya kwi-2,1 sezigidi zabantu.

eng: life expectancy is now firmly on an upward trend.
xho: ixesha elilindelekileyo lokuphila emhlabeni ngoku likhula ngamandla.

eng: south africans are now living longer.
xho: abemi bomzantsi afrika ngoku baphila ixesha elidana.

eng: the target for the next administration is to ensure that at least 4.6 million people are enrolled in the anti-retroviral programme.
xho: injongo ephambili yorhulumente olandelayo kukuqinisekisa abantu abazizigidi ezi-4,6 babhalisiwe kwinkqubo yee-arv.

eng: we acknowledge the contribution of the south african national aids council for the hard work.
xho: siyalibulela igalelo lebhunga lesizwe likagawulayo lasemzantsi afrika ngomsebenzi omkhulu.

eng: while celebrating our success, we must not be complacent.
xho: ngeli xesha sibhiyozela iimpumelelo zethu, akufuneki sibonakalise ukungakhathali.

eng: the prevention work must still continue so that we can reach that goal of zero hiv infections sooner.
xho: uthintelo kusafuneka luqhubekekile ukuze sikwazi ukufikelela kamsinyane koko sizisikele kona kokungabikho kosulelwa yi-hiv.

eng: at a broader level, we will enter a new phase in the implementation of the national health insurance programme which will extend quality healthcare to the poor.
xho: kwizinga elithe gabalala ngokuthe chatha, siza kungena kwisigaba esitsha ekuphunyezweni kwenkqubo ye-inshorensi yezempilo yesizwe eza kunabisela inkathalelo yezempilo esemgangathweni kwabahluphekileyo.

eng: honourable chairperson of the ncop,honourable speakerthe overall crime rate has decreased by 21 percent since 2002 and work is ongoing to make communities safer.
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyosihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncop,izinga lolwaphulo-mthetho liphelele lihle kangangama-21% ukususela ngowama-2002 kwaye umsebenzi usaqhubekeka ukwenza ukuba iindawo zasekuhlaleni zikhuseleke ngakumbi.

eng: one of the key focus areas is to eradicate violence against women and children.
xho: eminye yemiba efuna ingqwalasela emandla kukuncothula ubundlobongela kubantu basetyhini nabantwana.

eng: we have introduced a number of measures to respond to this challenge.
xho: sivelise amanyathelo aliqela ukuhlangabezana nalo mngeni.

eng: these include the reopening of the family violence, child protection and sexual offences units as well as the sexual offences courts.
xho: oku kuquka ukuvulwa kwakhona kwamacandelo wobundlobongela kwintsapho, ukhuseleko lwabantwana necandelo lolwaphulo-mthetho ngezesondo kwakunye neenkundla zolwaphulo-mthetho lwezesondo.

eng: we thank the many ngos that promote the rights of women and children who contribute positively to this important work.
xho: siyayibulela imibutho emininzi engekho phantsi kukarhulumente ekukhuthazeni amalungelo wabasetyhini nawabantwana nethi ibe negalelo elithembisayo kulo msebenzi ubaluleke kangaka.

eng: our country continues to be the target of rhino poachers.
xho: ilizwe lethu lisaqhubekeka ukuba sisisulu sababulali bemikhombe ngeenjongo zokuyityhuthula iimpondo.

eng: our law enforcement agencies are working hard to arrest this scourge.
xho: amagosa wethu wezomthetho asebenza nzima ukuzama ukuphelisa esi sibetho.

eng: we have also reached agreements with china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique and other sadc countries to work together to stop this crime.
xho: side safikelela kwizivumelwano ne-china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique namanye amazwe woluntu oluphuhlileyo lwe-afrika esemazantsi (i-sadc) ukuba sisebenzisane ukuphelisa olu lwaphulo-mthetho.

eng: we thank the business community and all south africans who participate in the campaign to save the rhino.
xho: siyababulela abezoshishino nabo bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika abathe bathatha inxaxheba kwiphulo lokusindisa imikhombe.

eng: compatriotsthe independence of the judiciary has been further enhanced by the establishment of the office of the chief justice as a separate institution from the department of justice and constitutional development.
xho: bantu bakuthi,ukuzimela kweejaji kuxhotyiswe ngakumbi ngokusekwa kwe-ofisi yejaji eyintloko njengeziko elohlukileyo kwisebe lezobulungisa nophuhliso lomgaqo-siseko.

eng: we have passed several pieces of legislation to support this new role of the office of the chief justice.
xho: siphumeze imithetho eliqela ukuxhasa le ndima intsha ye-ofisi yejaji eyintloko.

eng: progress is being made in the transformation of the judiciary to reflect the race and gender demographics of the country.
xho: inkqubela phambili ekudaleni inguqu kwiijaji iyenziwa ukuba zibonakalise uhlanga nesini ngokwendlela abantu abahlala ngayo kweli lizwe.

eng: the chief justice of the republic continues to champion and lead this transformation.
xho: ijaji eyintloko yerhiphabliki iza kuqhubekeka ukuba nguvulindlela ize ikhokele ukudalwa kwale nguqu.

eng: black judges (african, indian and coloured) now constitute 61% of all judges.
xho: iijaji ezimnyama (abantsundu, amandiya nabebala) ngoku benza ama-61% azo zonke iijaji.

eng: however, the acute under-representation of women on the bench remains of concern.
xho: noxa kunjalo, ubungozi bokungamelwa kwabantu basetyhini ezijajini kusaxhalabisa.

eng: of the judicial establishment of 239 judges, only 76 are women.
xho: ekumiselweni kweejaji ezingama-239, zingama-76 kuphela ezingabantu basetyhini.

eng: the challenge is to transform the legal profession broadly in order to nourish the pool from which female judges can be appointed.
xho: umngeni kukudala inguqu kulo lonke ubizo lwezomthetho ngokubanzi khona ukuze kondleke elo qela iijaji ezingabantu basetyhini banokuchongwa kulo.

eng: the finalisation of the legal practice bill will assist to broaden the pool from which potential judicial officers could be selected.
xho: ukuqukunjelwa komthetho oyilwayo wokusebenza ngezomthetho kuza kunceda ukwenza banzi iqela apho kunokuchongwa kulo amagosa anokuba ziijaji.

eng: honourable speaker and chairperson,south africans are united in wanting a corruption free society.
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyo,sihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncopabemi bomzantsi afrika bamanyene ekufuneni uluntu ekungekho rhwaphilizo kulo.

eng: fighting corruption within the public service is yielding results.
xho: ukulwa urhwaphilizo kunye ngeenkonzo zikarhulumente kuveza iziqhamo.

eng: since the launch of the national anti-corruption hotline by the public service commission, over 13 000 cases of corruption and maladministration have been referred to government departments for further handling and investigation.
xho: ukususela ukumiselwa komnxeba ongavalwayo wesizwe wokulwa urhwaphilizo wekhomishoni yeenkonzo zikarhulumente, ngamatyala angaphezulu kwe-13 000 orhwaphilizo nolawulo olugwenxa asele ethunyelwe kumasebe karhulumente ukuze asebenze ngawo nokuwaphanda.

eng: government has recovered more than 320-million rand from perpetrators through the national anti-corruption hotline.
xho: urhulumente ngomnxeba ongavalwayo wesizwe wokulwa urhwaphilizo sele ehluthe ngaphezulu kwama-r320 ezigidi kubenzi bobu bubi.

eng: some of the successes of the national anti-corruption hotline include the following:to prevent corruption in the supply chain system, government has decided to establish a central tender board to adjudicate tenders in all spheres of government.
xho: ezinye zeempumelelo zomnxeba ongavalwayo wesizwe wokulwa urhwaphilizo ziquka ezi zilandelayo:ukuthintela urhwaphilizo kwinkqubo yokuthenga nokuthengiswa, urhulumente ugqibe ekubeni aseke ibhodi yeziniki-maxabiso enye ukuze ibe yiyo egweba ngeziniki-maxabiso kuwo onke amazika aseburhulumenteni.

eng: this body will work with the chief procurement officer whose main function will be to check on pricing and adherence to procedures as well as fairness.
xho: le bhodi iza kusebenza negosa eliyintloko lenkqubo yokuthenga nokuthengisa elimsebenzi walo ongundoqo ikukukhangela amaxabiso nokuthotyelwa kwenkqubo kwakunye nokuthi kungabikho mkhethe.

eng: the special investigating unit is investigating maladministration or alleged corruption in a number of government departments and state entities, through 40 proclamations signed by the president during this administration.
xho: icandelo lophando olulodwa liphanda ulawulo olugwenxa okanye izityholo zorhwaphilizo kumasebe karhulumente aliqela kunye namaqumrhu aseburhulumenteni, ngezibhengezo ezingama-40 ezityikitywe ngumongameli ngexesha lolu lawulo.

eng: we will keep the public informed of the outcome of the investigations.
xho: uluntu siyakulazisa ngeziphumo zolu phando.

eng: in the first six months of last year, the asset forfeiture unit paid a total of 149 million rand into the criminal assets recovery account and to the victims of crime.
xho: kwiinyanga zokuqala ezintandathu zalo nyaka uphelileyo, icandelo lokuthimba iimpahla elibizwa lihlawule imali engangezigidi ezili-r149 kwi-akhawunti yokubuyiselwa kwempahla efunyenwe ngolwaphulo-mthetho nakumaxhoba olwaphulo-mthetho.

eng: this is 170% above its target of 55 million rand and is higher than it has ever achieved in a full year.
xho: oku kungaphezulu kangange-170% kumthamo elizimisele wona wezigidi ezingama-r55 kwaye ingaphezulu kunoko yakhe yakufumana kunyaka ophelileyo.

eng: last year, the competition authorities investigated large-scale price fixing in the construction industry and fined guilty companies 1.4 billion rand.
xho: kulo nyaka uphelileyo, ugunyaziwe wezokhuphiswano uphande izinga elikhulu lokunyuswa kwamaxabiso ngokungekho mthethweni kwishishini lezokwakha waza wohlwaya ezo nkampani zinetyala imali engangesi-r1,4 seebhiliyoni.

eng: further steps against those involved are now underway.
xho: amanyathelo alandelayo ngokuchasene nabo bachaphazelekayo ayaqhubeka ngoku.

eng: compatriots,i would now like to touch briefly on the provision of basic services to our people.
xho: bantu bakuthi,ndingathanda ukukhe ndichaphazele nje ngokufutshane kubonelelo lonikezelo nkonzo kubantu bethu.

eng: over the past 20 years, remarkable achievements have been made in increasing access to services such as water, sanitation and electricity.
xho: kule minyaka ingama-20 idlulileyo, kubekho iimpumelelo ezincomekayo ezenziweyo ekwandeni kokufikelela kwiinkonzo ezifana namanzi, ugutyulo nombane.

eng: government has begun an intensive programme to eliminate the bucket system as part of restoring the dignity of our people.
xho: urhulumente uqalise inkqubo engqongqo yokuphelisa inkqubo yamabhakethi njengenxalenye yokubuyisela isidima kubantu bethu.

eng: phase one of the programme will eradicate buckets in formalized townships of the free state, eastern cape and northern cape.
xho: isigaba sokuqala sale nkqubo siza kuncothula amabhakethi kwiilokishi ezisesikweni zasefreystata, empuma koloni nasemntla koloni.

eng: phase two will eradicate buckets in informal settlements in all provinces.
xho: isigaba sesibini siza kuncothula amabhakethi kumatyotyombe wawo onke amaphondo.

eng: in housing, about 3 million housing units and more than 855 thousand serviced sites were delivered since 1994. nearly 500 informal settlements have been replaced with quality housing and basic services over the past five years.
xho: kwezezindlu, kunikezelwe ngezindlu ezimalunga nezigidi ezintathu neziza ezifumana iinkonzo ezingaphezulu kwama-855 wamawaka ukususela ngowe-1994.

eng: the next administration will promote better located mixed income housing projects.
xho: kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo ziilokishi zamatyotyombe ezingama-500 ekwakhiwe izindlu ezisemgangathweni endaweni yawo nezineenkonzo ezingundoqo.

eng: compatriots,some communities still do not have these services especially in informal settlements and rural areas.
xho: bantu bakuthi,ezinye iindawo zasekuhlaleni azikabi nazo ezi nkonzo ingakumbi ematyotyombeni nakwiindawo zasemaphandleni.

eng: we are therefore working with all spheres of government to ensure the provision of these services, especially in the 23 municipalities with the greatest number of backlogs.
xho: ngoko ke sisebenzisana nawo onke amazinga aseburhulumenteni ukuqinisekisa ngokubonelela ngezi nkonzo, ingakumbi koomasipala abangama-23 abanelona nani liphezulu lokusilela.

eng: compatriotsin last year’s state of the nation address, i raised my concern with the manifestation of violence in some of the protests taking place in our country.
xho: bantu bakuthi,kwi-sona yokugqibela, ndavakalisa ukuxhalaba kwam ngokubonakala kobundlongondlongo kweminye imigushuzo yoqhankqalazo eqhubeka kweli lizwe lethu.

eng: violent protests have taken place again around the country in the past few weeks.
xho: uqhankqalazo olunobundlongondlongo luphinde lwaqhubeka apha kweli lizweni kwezi veki zimbalwa zidlulileyo.

eng: also worrying is what appears to be premeditated violence, as is the case with the use of petrol bombs and other weapons during protests.
xho: okunye okuxhalabisayo kukukhangeleka ngathi ubundlongondlongo bucetyiwe, njengoko kunjalo nasekusetyenzisweni kweziqhushumbisi zepetula nezinye izixhobo ngeli xesha lo qhankqalazo.

eng: the democratic government supports the right of citizens to express themselves.
xho: urhulumente wolawulo lwentando yesininzi uyalixhasa ilungelo labemi ukuba bavakalise indlela abeva ngayo.

eng: the right to protest, peacefully and unarmed, is enshrined in the constitution.
xho: ilungelo lokuqhankqalaza, ngoxolo kwaye kungaxhotywanga, lichaziwe kumgaqo-siseko.

eng: however, when protests threaten lives and property and destroy valuable infrastructure intended to serve the community, they undermine the very democracy that upholds the right to protest.
xho: kodwa ke, xa imigushuzo yoqhankqalazo ibeka esichengeni ubomi neempahla ize itshabalalise iziseko ezingundoqo ezixabisekileyo ekulindeleke ukuba zisetyenziswe luluntu, oku kuthetha ukuba abaqhankqalazi badelela kwale ntando yesininzi iba nika ilungelo lokuqhankqalazaeyona nto iqaqambileyo itshiwoyo kwezi zehlo zoqhankqalazo lwasemzantsi afrika iba kukuba kubhekiswe kwizityholo zokusilela kukarhulumente.

eng: the dominant narrative in the case of the protests in south africa has been to attribute them to alleged failures of government.
xho: kodwa ke le migushuzo yoqhankqalazo ayikho ngenxa “yokusilela” kukarhulumente kodwa ikwa kho nangenxa yeempumelelo kunikezelo lweenkonzo ezingundoqo.

eng: when 95% of households have access to water, the 5% who still need to be provided for, feel they cannot wait a moment longer.
xho: xa kunikezelwa amanzi kwimizi engama-95%, esi si-5% sisalindele ukulungiselelwa, siziva singesenakulinda.

eng: success is also the breeding ground of rising expectations.
xho: impumelelo nayo ikwadala ukukhula kwethemba loko kulindelweyo.

eng: let me also add honourable members, that any loss of life at the hands of the police in the course of dealing with the protests cannot be overlooked or condoned.
xho: mandongeze kwakhona malungu ahloniphekileyo, nakuphi na ukuphulukana komntu nobomi ezandleni zamapolisa ngeli xesha esebenza ngoqhankqalazo akunakungahoywa okanye kukhuthazwe.

eng: loss of life is not a small matter.
xho: ukuphulukana nobomi asiyonto incinci.

eng: we need to know what happened, why it happened.
xho: kufanele ukuba siyazi ukuba kwenzeke ntoni, kutheni kwenzekile?

eng: any wrongdoing must be dealt with and corrective action must be taken.
xho: nakuphi na ukwenza okugwenxa kufuneka kusetyenziwe ngako kwaye kufuneka kuthathwe amanyathelo okukulungisa oko.

eng: police must act within the ambit of the law at all times.
xho: ngalo lonke ixesha amapolisa kufuneka asebenze kwimida evunyelwa ngumthetho.

eng: having said this, we should also as a society be concerned that between 2005 and 2013, close to 800 police officerswere killed.
xho: ndikuthethile oko, kwakhona njengesizwe kukwafanele sixhalabe yinto yokuba phakathi kowama-2005 nowama-2013, phantse ibe ngamapolisa angama-800 abuleweyo.

eng: the police are protectors and are the buffer between a democratic society based on the rule of law, and anarchy.
xho: amapolisa ngabakhuseli kwaye angabadambisi phakathi koluntu lwentando yesininzi ngokusekelezelwe kulawulo lomthetho, nokungalawuleki.

eng: as we hold the police to account, we should be careful not to end up delegitimising them and glorify anarchy in our society.
xho: njengoko silindele ukuba amapolisa ephendulile, kufanele silumke singawenzi angabikho semthethweni size singcwalise ukungalawuleki kuluntu lwethu.

eng: the culture of violence originated from the apartheid past.
xho: isithethe sobundlongondlongo sisusela ngexesha localucalulo.

eng: we need to conduct anintrospectionin our efforts to get rid of this scourge.
xho: kufanele sizikhangele thina ngokwethu kumalinge wethu okohlukana nesi sibetho.

eng: as leaders from all walks of life, we must reflect on what we did or did not do, to systematically root out the violence that surfaced in protests during the early days of our democracy.
xho: njengeenkokheli zankalo zonke, kufuneka sibonakalise ukuba yintoni esiyenzileyo okanye esingayenzanga, ukuze sibuncothule ubundlongondlongo obabubonakala kuqhankqalazo lweentsuku zokuqala zolawulo lwethu lwentando yesininzi.

eng: we have a collective responsibility to build a society that respects the rule of law, respects one another and which respects life and property.
xho: sinoxanduva sisonke lokwakha uluntu oluwuhloniphileyo umthetho, lihloniphane nolukwahlonipha ubomi nempahla.

eng: we should work together to rebuild ubuntu and a culture of responsibility in our society.
xho: kufuneka sisebenzisane ukwakha ubuntu nokuba nomoya wobunene kuluntu lwethu.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,a decision has been taken to improve functioning of local government.
xho: somlomo ohloniphekileyo,sihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncop,kuthathwe isigqibo sokuphucula oorhulumente basekhaya abasebenzayo.

eng: the amendment of the municipal systems act is intended to improve the capacity of municipalities to deliver services.
xho: ukuhlonyelwa komthetho weenkqubo zikamasipala kulindeleke ukuba kuphucule ukusebenza koomasipala ekunikezeleni iinkonzo.

eng: qualified and experienced personnel must be deployed in municipalities.
xho: kufuneka kutyalwe abasebenzi abanamabakala emfundo namava afanelekileyo koomasipala.

eng: we also need to strengthen existing forums of people’s participation and enable our people to play a greater role in development.
xho: sikwafanele ukuba someleze amaqonga akhoyo wokuthatha inxaxheba koluntu size sivumele nabantu bethu ukuba badlale indima enkulu ngakumbi kuphuhliso.

eng: the fight against corruption must be intensified as well, especially given reports that some services are interrupted or stopped, so that certain people could provide those services at cost to the state.
xho: kufuneka siwuqinise nawo umlo wokulwa norhwaphilizo, ingakumbi xa siqwalasele imeko yokuba ezinye iinkonzo ziyaphazamiseka okanye zinqunyanyiswe, ukuze ezo nkonzo zinikezelwe kurhulumente ngabantu abathile ngexabiso.

eng: honourable speaker and chairpersondemocratic south africa’s foreign policy was shaped many decades ago during the fierce international campaign to isolate the apartheid state.
xho: le miba ibekwa phambili kurhulumente olandelayosomlomo ohloniphekileyosihlalo ohloniphekileyo we-ncopumgaqo-nkqubo wobudlelwane namazwe angaphesheya womzantsi afrika wentando yesininzi waqulunqwa kumashumi eminyaka eyadlulayo ngexesha lephulo loburhalarhume bezizwe ngezizwe lokwenza ikheswa ilizwe elinombuso wocalucalulo.

eng: anc president oliver tambo played a key role in that regard, assisted by among others, the late johnny makatini, former head of international affairs.
xho: umongameli we-anc u-oliver tambo wadlala indima ebaluleke kakhulu kulo meko, encediswa ngabo kwakukho phakathi kwabo, ongasekhoyo ujohnny makatini, owayesakuba yintloko yemicimbi yezizwe ngezizwe.

eng: his wife, mrs valerie makatini is one of our honoured guests this evening.
xho: inkosikazi yakhe, uvalerie makatini ngomnye weendwendwe zethu ezibalulekileyo ngokuhlwa nje.

eng: africa has remained at the centre of our foreign policy.
xho: i-afrika isoloko isembindini womgaqo-nkqubo wethu wobudlelwane namazwe angaphesheya.

eng: we have worked hard to strengthen support for the african union, sadc and all continental bodies whose purpose is to achieve peace and security.
xho: sisebenze ngokuzinikela ukomeleza inkxaso yembumba yamazwe ase-afrika, i-sadc kunye nayo yonke imibutho yelizwekazi eneenjongo zokuzisa uxolo nokhuseleko.

eng: we have also prioritised the promotion of regional economic integration, infrastructure development, intra-african trade and sustainable development in the continent.
xho: sikwakubeke phambili ukukhuthaza ukuhlanganiswa koqoqosho lommandla we-afrika, uphuhliso lweziseko ezingundoqo, urhwebo phakathi kwamazwe ase-afrika nophuhliso oluzinzileyo kwilizwekazi.

eng: this year we also submitted our third country report to the au african peer review mechanism which was well received.
xho: kulo nyaka sifake ingxelo yethu yesithathu yelizwe lethu kwinkqubo yokuzihlola kwamazwe ase-afrika yembumba yamazwe ase-afrika nethe yamkelwa.

eng: we continue to support peacemaking and conflict resolution.
xho: sisaqhubekeka ukuxhasa ukudalwa koxolo nokusonjululwa kwengxabano.

eng: progress is being made in negotiations between sudan and south sudan on outstanding issues following the secession.
xho: emveni kwale seshini inkqubela phambili kuthethathethwano oluphakathi kwe-sudan nesudan esezantsi kwimiba esaseleyo isaqhubekeka.

eng: following requests from sri lanka and south sudan for assistance in bringing about peace and reconciliation, mr cyril ramaphosa, has been appointed as south africa’s special envoy to the two countries.
xho: ngenxa yesicelo sokuzisa uxolo noxolelwano esivela esri lanka nasemzantsi, umnu cyril ramaphosa, uchongelwe ukuba ayokuba sisithunywa esikhethekileyo sasemzantsi afrika kula mazwe mabini.

eng: his expertise in conflict resolution and negotiations as well as our country’s experience in this regard, will greatly assist the two countries to resolve their problems.
xho: izakhono nobuchule bakhe ekusonjululweni kwengxabano nakuthethathethwano kwakunye namava wethu kwimeko enjalo, kuya kuwanceda kakhulu la mazwe ekusombululeni iingxaki zawo.

eng: we will continue to strengthen relations with europe, north america, latin america, asia and countries in the south.
xho: sizakuqhubekeka ukomeleza ubudlelwane namazwe afana neyurobhu, i-north america, i-latin america, i-asia namazwe asezantsi.

eng: participation in international multilateral forums such as the g20 have been beneficial for the country.
xho: ukuthatha inxaxheba kumaqonga wamaqela ngamaqela wezizwe ngezizwe afana ne-g20 kulixhamlisile ilizwe lethu.

eng: and joining the brazil, russia, india and china (bric) group in december 2010 counts as among the key achievements of the fourth administration.
xho: kwaye ukuzibandakanya neqela le-brazil, russia, india ne-china (i-bric) kweyomnga yowama-2010 kubalwa njengempumelelo engundoqo yalo rhulumente wesine.

eng: it was also a great honour to host the fifth brics summit on 27 march 2013 in durban, which saw the participation of african leaders to discuss developmental cooperation with brics.
xho: kwakhona ibe yinyhweba enkulu ukusingatha imbizo yesihlanu yamazwe e-brics ngomhla wama-27 kweyokwindla yowama-2013 ethekwini, nalapho kubonakele iinkokheli zase-afrika zithatha inxaxheba ekuxoxeni ngentsebenziswano yophuhliso kunye namazwe e-brics.

eng: we will continue to serve diligently in the united nations in promotion of strong international governance.
xho: sizakuqhubekeka ukusebenza ngokuzinikela kwizizwe ezimanyeneyo ukukhuthaza ulawulo lwezizwe ngezizwe olomeleleyo.

eng: we will also continue promoting the reform of the un security council and global financial institutions.
xho: kwakhona sizakuqhubekeka ukukhuthaza ukulungiswa kwebhunga lokhuselo lwezizwe ezimanyeneyo namaziko wezezimali ehlabathini jikelele.

eng: honourable membersas president of the cop17/cmp7 united nations climate change conference which was hosted in durban in 2011, south africa successfully placed the world on an unassailable course, through the adoption of the durban platform for enhanced action.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyonjengomongameli wengqungquthela (i-cop17/cmp7) eyingqungquthela engokuguquguquka kwesimo sezulu yezizwe ezimanyeneyo neyayisingethwe ethekwini ngowama-2011, umzantsi afrika ubeke ihlabathi ngokuyimpumelelo kwisimo sokungahlaseleki, ngokwamkela iqonga lasethekwini lamanyathelo axhotyisiweyo.

eng: compatriots,over the past 20 years we have hosted a number of international sporting and cultural visits, which has helped to boost social cohesion and unity.
xho: bantu bakuthi,kule minyaka ingama-20 idlulileyo sisingathe utyelelo lwezemidlalo neleenkcubeko zezizwe ngezizwe, noluthe lwanceda ukukhulisa intlalo-ntle nomanyano.

eng: in the past five years, south africa hosted the highly successful 2010 fifa soccer world cup and other key soccer, rugby and cricket tournament, which left a tangible feeling of pride and unity among all south africans.
xho: kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo, umzantsi afrika usingathe indebe yehlabathi yebhola ekhatywayo ye-fifa ngokubeyimpumelelo ephezulu neminye iminyhadala yebhola ekhatywayo, eyomboxo neyeqakamba, nokushiye imvakalelo eluqilima yokuzingca nomanyano phakathi kwabo bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika.

eng: as we celebrate 20 years of freedom, we will do so having done well in building a new heritage landscape for our country.
xho: xa sibhiyozela iminyaka engama-20 yenkululeko, sizakwenza oko sisebenze kakuhle ukwakha amagugu amatsha ngokwembonakalo yelizwe lethu.

eng: a number of new museums and monuments were established, including the statue of former president mandela which has become a landmark in the union buildings.
xho: kusekwe inani leemiziyamu nezakhiwo zesikhumbuzo, kuquka nomfanekiso kawayesakuba ngumongameli umandela nozakuba luphawu lwembonakalo kwizakhiwo zomdibaniso.

eng: more than 2000 geographical names have been changed in order to correct the ill-naming of places, as well as to give communities the right to determine the names of their areas.
xho: kutshintshwe amagama eendawo angaphezulu kwama-2 000 ukulungisa ukuthiywa kweendawo ngamagama angatshongo khona, kwakunye nokunika uluntu ilungelo lokuzithathela izigqibo ngamagama eendawo zabo.

eng: honourable membersallow me to acknowledge some of our compatriots who are making their mark in the world.
xho: malungu ahloniphekileyondivumeleni ukuba ndibulele abanye babantu bakuthi abazenzele igama ehlabathini.

eng: we congratulate ladysmith black mambazo on winning their fourth grammy award last month.
xho: siyavuyisana ne-lady smith black mambazo ngokuphumelela kwayo imbasa yayo yesine ebizwa i-grammy kule nyanga iphelileyo.

eng: we welcome the group leader, mr joseph shabalala, one of our guests this evening.
xho: siyayamkela inkokheli yeli qela, umnu ujoseph shabalala, nongomnye weendwendwe zethu ngokuhlwa nje.

eng: we also acknowledge ms yvonne chaka chaka who is one of our guests this evening.
xho: kwakhona sibulele unks yvonne chaka chaka olelinye leendwendwe zethu ngokuhlwa njewenza uninzi lomsebenzi oncomekayo njengonozakuzaku wenzondelelo wengxowa-mali yabantwana yezizwe ezimanyeneyo kamalaleveva e-afrika ekwasiso nesithunywa esikhethekileyo sezibhambathiso zophuhliso zemileniyamu sezizwe ezimanyeneyo sase-afrika.

eng: she is doing a lot of good work as the united nations children’s fund goodwill ambassador for malaria in africa and also the united nations millennium development goals special envoy for africa.
xho: kwakhona unks chaka chaka wawongwa ngembasa ye-crystal liqumrhu lezoqoqosho lehlabathi e-davos ngomsebenzi wakhe wobuntu awenzayo.

eng: ms chaka chaka was also honoured with the crystal award by the world economic forum in davos for her humanitarian work.
xho: kwakhona sikwahlonipa, obalaseleyo wethu ophumelele imbasa ye-oscar, unks charlize theron.

eng: ms theron is also the un messenger for peace.
xho: unks theron ukwangumthunywa woxolo wezizwe ezimanyeneyo.

eng: she also champions the fight against aids especially amongst the youth and young women.
xho: ukwa nguvulindlela wokulwa ugawulayo ingakumbi kulutsha namantombazana.

eng: she was also honoured by the world economic forum with a crystal award.
xho: naye wawongwa liqumrhu lezoqoqosho lehlabathi ngembasa ye-crystal.

eng: compatriotsyou would have noticed that in this sona we have given a report of the past five yearsin particular and over the past 20 years in general.
xho: bantu bakuthi,inokuba niqaphele ukuba kule sona sinikezele ingxelo yale minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo ngokukodwa nangaphezulu kule minyaka ingama-20 idlulileyo jikelele.

eng: this is not an occasion to present the programme of action for this financial year.
xho: lo asingomsitho wokunikezela ngenkqubo yemisebenzi karhulumente yalo nyaka-mali.

eng: that programme will be presented by the new government after the elections.
xho: lo nkqubo iza kunikezelwa ngurhulumente omtsha emva konyulo.

eng: to prepare for that first state of the nation address by the incoming administration later in the year, we have over the past year, been working on a medium term strategic framework.
xho: ukulungiselela le-sona yokuqala yorhulumente oza kungena apha ekuhambeni konyaka, kulo nyaka udlulileyo, siye sasebenza ngenkqubo-sikhokelo yesicwangciso-qhinga sesigaba esiphakathi.

eng: the framework has been designed as the first five year building block of the national development plan, from 2014 to 2019. it also incorporates key targets of the industrial policy action plan, the new growth path and infrastructure plan.
xho: le nkqubo-sikhokelo iyilwe njengesisekelo sale minyaka mihlanu yokuqala sesicwangciso sophuhliso sesizwe, ukususela ngowama-2014 ukuya kowama-2019.

eng: the intention is to table the draft framework to the first cabinet lekgotla after the elections.
xho: ikwa dibanisa oko kujoliswe kuko kungundoqo sisicwangciso sokusebenza komgaqo-nkqubo wezoshishino, umgaqo-nkquo wendlela entsha yohlumo lwezoqoqosho nesicwangciso seziseko ezingundoqo.

eng: it will be refined by the new administration in line with its electoral mandate, so that work can start as soon as possible after the formation of a new government.
xho: injongo kukubeka uyilo lwale nkqubo-sikhokelo phambi kwe-lekgotla yekhabhinethi yokuqala emva konyulo.
